title: How to Make Apricot, Ginger and Hazelnut Cupcakes

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 190°C / 375°F, gas mark 5.
steps.description: Prepare the two 18 centimeter (7.1 in) sandwich tins.

steps.headline: Cream the butter and muscovado sugar in a bowl until light in colour.
steps.description: Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.

steps.headline: Fold in the flour and spices.
Add the fruit, nuts, carrot and milk and mix through.
Divide the mixture evenly between both cake tins.
steps.description: Place on the middle oven rack in the preheated oven. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the heat and leave to cool on a cooling rack.

steps.headline: Make the topping.
steps.description: Cream the cheese and sugar in a bowl by hand, taking care not over-mix. Add the lemon. Add the topping to the cupcakes once cooled.

text: Preheat your oven to 190°C / 375°F, gas mark 5. Prepare the two 18 centimeter (7.1 in) sandwich tins. Cream the butter and muscovado sugar in a bowl until light in colour. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Fold in the flour and spices. Stir well. Add the fruit, nuts, carrot and milk and mix through.  Divide the mixture evenly between both cake tins. Place on the middle oven rack in the preheated oven. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the heat and leave to cool on a cooling rack. Make the topping. Cream the cheese and sugar in a bowl by hand, taking care not over-mix. Add the lemon. Add the topping to the cupcakes once cooled. Finished.
